snippet: Gerry Adams, the leader of Sinn Fein, remains under questioning about a gruesome 1972 murder, as his political party said that the police were playing politics.
abstract: Northern Ireland police are granted permission to keep Sinn Fein leader Gerry Adams in custody for another 48 hours for questioning about 1972 murder of Jean McConville; party claims that police are playing politics before local and European parliamentary elections.

byline.original: By STEVEN ERLANGER and DOUGLAS DALBY
byline.contributor: Steven Erlanger reported from London, and Douglas Dalby from Dublin.

lead_paragraph: Gerry Adams, the leader of Sinn Fein, remains under questioning about a gruesome 1972 murder, as his political party said that the police were playing politics.

headline.main: Sinn Fein Leader’s Time in Jail Is Extended, as Party Sees Political Motives by Police
headline.print_headline: Sinn Fein Leader’s Time in Jail Is Extended, as Party Sees Political Motives by Police
